intro: Cacalia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its scientific name "cuneifolia," which refers to the wedge-shaped base of the leaves. Cacalia cuneifolia is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
